definition: masquerade
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
variant of 花[hua1]
(of a woman) to adorn oneself/makeup/adornment/trousseau/stage makeup and costume
to dance/to wield/to brandish
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to balance an account/accountancy/accounting

sentences.english: These masquerade balls became popular in continental Europe in the 17th century.
sentences.chinese: 這種化妝舞會在十七世紀的歐陸頗爲盛行。

sentences.english: This weekend, I'm going to a fancy dress ball.
sentences.chinese: 週末我要參加一個化妝舞會。

sentences.english: This is a masked ball, you should conceal yourself.
sentences.chinese: 那可是化妝舞會，你得把自己“藏起來”。

sentences.english: Festival categories of clothing. Makeup applied to Christmas parties and other occasions.
sentences.chinese: 節日類服裝，適用於聖誕化妝舞會等場合。

sentences.english: Halloween nis also a time for masquerade parties.
sentences.chinese: 萬聖節前夜還是舉辦化妝舞會的好時機。

sentences.english: Some people dressed up as clowns at the costume party.
sentences.chinese: 一些人在化妝舞會上打扮成小丑模樣。

sentences.english: A friend once invited me to a costume party.
sentences.chinese: 有朋友邀請我去參加化妝舞會。

sentences.english: At least it is, but it's for fancy dress.
sentences.chinese: 好吧就算是童裝，但那是化妝舞會穿的。

sentences.english: It's similar to going out in a costume at night with a mask on to cover the face (see research on deindividuation).
sentences.chinese: 這就像在晚上頭戴面具去參加化妝舞會。

definition: to return something to its rightful owner
doddering/senile
hobbyist/amateur
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
to whisper to one another's ear
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
a short time/a little while
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
grand dreams/unrealistic ideas (idiom)
to walk right into the trap
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
extracurricular reading material
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
psychiatric hospital
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
